ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot about writing and writing styles that suit different occasions

This course definitely improved my writing (not featured here). I learned how to write a research paper, and how to join in discussion in a seminar style classroom. The content of this class was very fulfilling.

Professor Jones was a fantastic lecturer, who really encouraged my ever-growing journey as a writer. I learned the art of argumentative writing, and charitable approaches to opinions that were unlike my own. Also, I really gained a great deal of knowledge about art and its impact on our lives!
I gleaned a lot about self-image, art perception, and also close reading analysis and essay writing techniques in general. It was extremely insightful to me in more ways than I imagined.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really liked the progression of paper styles, however I think that less rigid assignments could be beneficial

I really like the small number of students in this class. It led to a good bonding experience, and I recieved very direct feedback. I would have liked to have taken a deeper look into beauty itself, but we got through a lot of material regardless of the short time that we had together.
Maybe more feedback and close analysis on our paper
Sometimes I wish I had more time to discuss the readings in class, so maybe allot more class time to spread out over all readings.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It is a great class to improve your academic writing, especially if you find writing daunting.
Yes, English 114 is a great tool, especially for student who are timid about writing at Yale.
If you can replace foreign language requirement with 114, do it.
Yes - I think it's a great class that facilitates discussion much more easily than others.
